items.title: Spot Gas Prices Vary as Weather Shifts Reshape Regional Demand
items.summary: Cash gas prices were mixed Wednesday as traders weighed shifting regional demand expectations tied to changing weather patterns.

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Recover Ground, but Analysts See Upside Running Thin
items.summary: February Nymex natural gas futures turned higher Wednesday following a five-day losing streak as market participants looked ahead to the latest storage data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) and another burst of cold-weather-drive

items.title: Lake Charles LNG Project Still Alive With Talks for Potential Sale Said Advancing
items.summary: At least two buyers, including MidOcean Energy LLC, have been lined up to purchase Energy Transfer LP’s (ET) Lake Charles LNG project after it suspended development last month.

items.title: Midday Snapshot: Henry Hub Natural Gas Spot Jumps
items.summary: Natural gas physical markets were mixed midday Wednesday as broad gains mostly offset sharp declines in the Northeast and West Texas.

items.title: Permian Bottlenecks Tip Mexico’s El Encino Gas Prices Into Negative Territory
items.summary: Natural gas prices at Encino via El Encino-Ojinga in Mexico have repeatedly fallen into negative territory since early December amid unrelenting pipeline restrictions upstream at Waha, according to an NGI analysis.

items.title: Afternoon Pulse: Natural Gas Futures Sustain Upward Move
items.summary: Natural gas futures eased off earlier highs but remained up day/day into midday Wednesday, supported by technicals and signs of colder weather emerging late in the forecast window.

items.title: Prospects Dim for U.S. LNG Projects Left Behind in 2025, but Some Still Close to Reaching FID
items.summary: While 2025 was a banner year for new North American LNG projects, a coterie of U.S. projects that were considered close to advancing have seen their timelines for final investment decisions (FID) slip into the new year.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Henry Hub Natural Gas Cash Reclaims $3
items.summary: Natural gas physical markets were mixed early Wednesday, with Henry Hub cash trading above $3 for the first time this year.

items.title: LNG Canada Ramp-Up to Drive Record January Exports, Boost Natural Gas Demand
items.summary: As the second train at LNG Canada restarts, exports from the country are expected to reach an all-time high this month, adding demand for natural gas out of the Western Canada Sedimentary Basin (WCSB).

items.title: Natural Gas-Fed Data Centers Face ‘Year of Load Accountability’ as Scrutiny Builds
items.summary: With data center demand surging and infrastructure struggling to keep pace, utilities, pipeline operators and regulators are sharpening their pencils around what gets served, a shift that could make 2026 a more disciplined and more contested year for

items.title: China Bans Rare Earths Exports To Japan Over Taiwan Spat
items.summary: China has banned the export of several rare earth minerals to Japan over controversial remarks made by Japan’s Prime Minister regarding Taiwan, marking a new low in deteriorating relationships between the two trade partners. According to a commerce m

items.title: Why Venezuela’s Vast Oil Wealth Couldn't Prevent Its Collapse
items.summary: The dramatic events over the weekend in Venezuela have renewed global attention on a country that, on paper, should be one of the world’s great energy powers. Venezuela holds the largest proven oil reserves on Earth, yet its oil industry has been in

items.title: The UAE’s $150 Billion Gas Bet Could Upend Global LNG Markets
items.summary: There is a lot more to the UAE’s recently announced US$150 billion turbo-boost to its gas sector than meets the eye. It is true that it should deliver multiple economic benefits for the Middle Eastern country on a scale disproportionately larger than

items.title: The Capture of Maduro Marks the Return of Hard Power Politics
items.summary: The season of peace on earth and goodwill to all men did not last long, and while I’ll shed no tears at seeing a corrupt dictator snatched from his lair, it’s fair to say that 2026 is off to an uneasy start. The market response to Donald Trump’s auda

items.title: OPEC+ Compensation Cuts Triple as Key Producers Move to Rein in Oversupply
items.summary: Four key Opec+ producers have pledged to deepen their compensation cuts in the first half of 2026 as the organization looks to improve compliance amid oversupplied oil markets. The UAE, Iraq, Kazakhstan and Oman will implement output cuts totaling 82
